intro.p: In March 2025, a national education nonprofit surveyed college faculty about the role of AI in the classroom. The survey was conducted in English and {{lanuage}}. To conduct the survey, the nonprofit created a website. The nonprofit promoted the availability of the survey on social media, emailed faculty directly to invite them to respond, and also asked faculty to forward the survey to their colleagues. Interested faculty could go to the website, enter an email address ending in .edu and upload a picture of their faculty ID card to validate them as college faculty members and then answer the survey.

850 faculty responded to the survey. Respondents were asked to what degree they agreed with the following, using a 5-point scale: “Strongly Agree,” “Agree,” “Neutral,” “Disagree,” or “Strongly Disagree.””

item.p: Out-of-touch professors should harshly crack down on lazy students using AI to cheat on their assignments by completely banning it in their rigorous classes, if they want students to learn anything.
Complacent and profit-driven universities are turning a blind eye to the out-of-control misuse of AI by students, doing almost nothing to address the crisis.
